page.title: 17THE HOLY WELL, MALVERN WELLS
page.content: It is known that the{Benedictines}used the spring water for baptism in the 16th century and that it has been bottled since 1622.{Holy Well and Eye {Well}200 metres up the hill were owned by the{Hornyold family}from 1558 to 1919. In the 1740's{Dr Wall}publicised their health properties and{Wells {House}became a hydropath.{Rock House was built as an overflow in 1812. {Cuff's}bottled the water from 1919 to 1955 but thereafter Holy Well fell into disrepair until major restoration under a scheme adopted for{European {Heritage Year 1975.}New catchment works have restored the water to its former purity and it can be drunk unfiltered. It never dries up and is scrutinised regularly by environmental health experts. The revival of interest in spas has brought many visitors to this fairly remote spot.
